description:
Dashboard Version: v1.0.7

Fixes
1. Resolved panel duplication caused by the introduction of objectstore in metrics like purefb_array_performance_bandwidth_bytes.
2. Fixed Average Latency panel to include ,protocol=~"$protocol" in the aggregation for correct filtering.
3. Replaced rate() with avg_over_time() in top-N panels for improved accuracy with non-counter metrics.
4. Replaced @ end() with offset 2m in top-N panels to reduce "No Data" issues due to scrape timing mismatches.

Enhancements
1. Removed the left-hand metrics text panel as requested by users.
2. Replaced the image in the Overview section with text to prevent broken image icon.
3. Added collapsible sections for Filesystems, Objectstore, and Array metrics to help users focus only on relevant data and reduce query load.
4. Updated the "Average Total Bandwidth" panel to include protocol filtering and display values with 1 decimal place.
5. Added detailed explanations to top-N panels to help users understand how the queries work and why data may sometimes be missing.

options.content: # PURE STORAGE # FlashBlade // ## Overview Fleet wide performance and capacity overview for Pure Storage FlashBlade. The following endpoints must be scraped for all panels to successfully display results. `/metrics/array`, `/metrics/filesystems`, `/metrics/objectstore` For a full list of available metrics, go to [Semantic Conventions for Pure FlashBlade Metrics](https://github.com/PureStorage-OpenConnect/pure-fb-openmetrics-exporter/blob/main/specification/metrics/purefb-metrics.md)

targets.expr: sum(purefb_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance", env=~"$env", severity="critical"}) by (instance) OR on() sum(purefb_alerts_open{instance=~"$instance"}*0) by (instance)

panels.title: Sum Array Space Utilization by Type
Avg Over Time IOPS by IO Type
Avg Over Time IOPS by All Protocols

panels.description:
`/metrics/filesystems` endpoint required for this panel.

##### Panel Overview
This panel displays the top `$TopItems` entities across selected sources based on a chosen metric. It uses two Prometheus queries:

- **Query 1:** Calculates the average metric value per entity over the selected time range.
- **Query 2:** Selects the top-N entities using `avg_over_time(... offset 2m)` to ensure stable, recent values and avoid scrape timing issues.

Only entities found in **both queries** (via an `AND` operator) are shown.  This query is **resource-intensive** for both Prometheus and the browser.

---

##### Why You Might See “No Data”
- The top-N query evaluates **2 minutes before the end** of the time range.
- If the average query doesn’t return data at the **same timestamp**, the `AND` will drop unmatched results.
- This may happen when:
  - The time range ends at “now” and Prometheus hasn’t scraped yet
  - Data is delayed or sparse near the end of the range
  - Timestamps differ between queries due to offset or step alignment

---

##### How to Improve Results
- Set the time range to end slightly **before now** (`offset 2m`)
- Keep the panel interval aligned with the metric scrape interval (Auto is usually fine)
- Use shorter time ranges (e.g., 30m–2h instead of days)
- Apply filters to reduce the number of entities or data points
- Consider using [recording rules](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/recording_rules/) to pre-aggregate data

targets.expr:
avg(purefb_file_systems_performance_bandwidth_bytes{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance"}) by (name,instance, dimension)
and
topk($TopItems, avg(avg_over_time(purefb_file_systems_performance_bandwidth_bytes{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance"}[$__range] offset 2m )) by (name,instance, dimension))

panels.title: Top $TopItems Avg Filesystem Throughput by IO Type

panels.description:
`/metrics/filesystems` endpoint required for this panel.

targets.expr:
avg(purefb_file_systems_performance_latency_usec{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance"}) by (name,dimension,instance)
and
topk($TopItems, avg(avg_over_time(purefb_file_systems_performance_latency_usec{env=~"$env", instance=~"$instance"}[$__range] offset 2m )) by (name,dimension,instance))

panels.title: Top $TopItems Avg File System Latency by IO Type

and

panels.title: Top $TopItems Avg Bucket Latency by IO Type & $instance arrays(s)

panels.description:
Recommended for single array only.

Panel will display "No Data" until there is at least 12 hours of data in the data source as this panel displays the last 90 days at 12 hour intervals.

targets.expr:
sum(purefb_array_space_bytes{instance=~"^$instance",env=~"^$env",type="file-system",space=~"snapshots|unique|destroyed"}) by (space)
#"optional granular detail"
#"using sum() to show total of all arrays"

sum(purefb_array_space_bytes{instance=~"^$instance",env=~"^$env",type="object-store",space=~"snapshots|unique|destroyed"}) by (space)
#"optional granular detail"
#"using sum() to show total of all arrays"

sum(purefb_array_space_bytes{instance=~"^$instance",env=~"^$env",type="array",space=~"total_physical|capacity"}) by (space)
#"using sum() to show total of all arrays"

panels.title: Capacity Utilization by Type & $instance array(s)

list.description: Dependency: Prometheus metrics MUST be tagged with an environment.
list.label: Env
list.name: env

title: Pure Storage FlashBlade - Overview
